result.title: Factors Shaping Consumer Purchase Attitudes Toward IT-Based Convergence Products and Their Competitive Implications
result.introduction: This study examines the factors influencing consumer purchase attitudes toward IT-based convergence products and explores the implications of these attitudes for corporate competitiveness.
result.main_body: The core factor shaping consumer purchase attitudes toward IT-based convergence products is their perceived purchase attitude, which forms the basis for purchase decision-making. Among these, utility is highlighted as a very important strategic approach for consumers when adopting IT convergence products or services. This indicates that consumers' perception of the usefulness and benefits of these products significantly drives their purchasing behavior.
result.conclusion: Succinctly, the perceived purchase attitudes of consumers, particularly the utility they derive from IT-based convergence products, are key factors. The implication for competitiveness is that understanding these attitudes enables companies to formulate strategies to strengthen their competitiveness, which is essential for successful market entry.
